The metabolic pathway identified in this experiment is the "Amino sugar and nucleotide sugar metabolism" pathway. This conclusion is supported by the alterations observed in several genes and compounds involved in this pathway. The genes GPI, FPGT, HEXB, GFUS, GCK, and PMM1 are all associated with the metabolism of amino sugars and nucleotide sugars. Similarly, the altered compounds, such as UDP-N-acetyl-D-galactosamine, UDP-N-acetyl-D-mannosaminouronate, N-Acetylneuraminate 9-phosphate, and D-Mannose 6-phosphate, are key intermediates in this pathway. These findings suggest that the observed condition is closely linked to the metabolism of amino sugars and nucleotide sugars.

target: Amino sugar and nucleotide sugar metabolism

List of genes : <<< CHKA,GPAT4,PLA2G2A,ETNK1 >>>
List of compounds : <<< 2-Acyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphoserine,Phosphodimethylethanolamine,Phosphatidylglycerol,Aminoacyl-phosphatidylglycerol,Diacetylheptaprenylglycerol,CDP-diacylglycerol,Phosphatidate,Phosphatidyl-N-dimethylethanolamine,Acyl-CoA,CDP-glycerol,Diethanolamine,1-Phosphatidyl-D-myo-inositol,L-Serine-phosphoethanolamine,N-Methylethanolamine phosphate,2,3-Bis-(O-phytanyl)-sn-glycerol 1-phosphate,1,2-Diacyl-sn-glycerol,Diacylglycerylhomoserine,Acyl-CoA,CDP-2,3-bis-(O-geranylgeranyl)-sn-glycerol,Phosphatidylethanolamine,2,3-Bis-(O-geranylgeranyl)-sn-glycerol 1-phosphate,Glycerone phosphate,Diacylglyceryl-N,N,N-trimethylhomoserine,sn-Glycero-3-phosphocholine,1-Acyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphoserine >>>

The metabolic pathway identified in this experiment is the Glycerophospholipid metabolism. This pathway is involved in the synthesis, degradation, and remodeling of glycerophospholipids, which are major components of biological membranes. The altered genes - CHKA, GPAT4, PLA2G2A, and ETNK1 - are all directly involved in this pathway. CHKA and GPAT4 are involved in the biosynthesis of glycerophospholipids, while PLA2G2A is involved in their degradation. ETNK1 is responsible for the conversion of phosphatidylethanolamine to phosphatidylcholine, a key step in this pathway. The altered compounds, such as phosphatidate, phosphatidylethanolamine, and various forms of acyl-CoA, are intermediates in this pathway, further supporting the involvement of Glycerophospholipid metabolism in the observed condition.

List of genes : <<< CA3,CA7,GLUD2,GLUL,CA12,CA8,CA13,GLUD1,CPS1,CA5A,CA2,CA6 >>>
List of compounds : <<< Ammonia,Nitrite,Hydrazine,Nitroalkane,Nitrogen >>>

The experiment comparing two conditions revealed that the nitrogen metabolism pathway was significantly altered. This conclusion is supported by the observed changes in multiple genes and compounds related to this pathway. The genes identified, including CA3, CA7, GLUD2, GLUL, CA12, CA8, CA13, GLUD1, CPS1, CA5A, CA2, and CA6, are all involved in nitrogen metabolism, specifically in the urea cycle and ammonia detoxification. The altered compounds, such as ammonia, nitrite, hydrazine, nitroalkane, and nitrogen, are also key intermediates in this pathway. Therefore, the data suggest that the nitrogen metabolism pathway is disrupted in the condition under study.

List of genes : <<< PLD2,PLA2G2D,SELENOI,PEDS1-UBE2V1,TMEM86B,PLD4,PAFAH1B3,JMJD7-PLA2G4B,LPCAT1,LPCAT4,ENPP6,PLA2G2E,PLA2G7,PLA2G12B,LPCAT2,CEPT1 >>>
List of compounds : <<< O-Alkylglycerone phosphate,sn-Glycero-3-phosphocholine,1-Alkyl-2-acetyl-sn-glycerol,Galactosyl-1-alkyl-2-acylglycerol,sn-Glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine,2-Acyl-1-(1-alkenyl)-sn-glycero-3-phosphate,Plasmenylcholine,1-Alkyl-2-acylglycerophosphoethanolamine,1-Alkyl-sn-glycerol,1-(1-Alkenyl)-sn-glycero-3-phosphate >>>

The metabolic pathway identified in the experiment is Ether lipid metabolism. This is supported by the altered genes and compounds. The genes PLD2, PLA2G2D, PLA2G2E, PLA2G7, PLA2G12B, and PLA2G4B are phospholipases, enzymes known to be involved in ether lipid metabolism. SELENOI, a selenoprotein, is also implicated in this pathway. Additionally, LPCAT1, LPCAT2, and LPCAT4 are lysophosphatidylcholine acyltransferases, enzymes responsible for the final step in ether lipid biosynthesis. The altered compounds, including O-Alkylglycerone phosphate, sn-Glycero-3-phosphocholine, and Plasmenylcholine, are intermediates and products of the ether lipid metabolism pathway. Therefore, the alterations in these genes and compounds strongly suggest the involvement of the Ether lipid metabolism pathway in the condition being studied.

List of genes : <<< ARSA,ACER1,GM2A,B4GALT5,SGPP2,CERS6,CERS1,CERS4,CERS3,B4GALNT1,SGMS1,HEXB,SMPD1,GBA1,ASAH2,PLPP3 >>>
List of compounds : <<< Ceramide phosphoethanolamine,Gangliotriaosylceramide-II3 sulfate,Psychosine,D-Galactosyl-N-acetyl-D-galactosaminyl-(N-acetylneuraminyl)-D-galactosyl-D-glucosylceramide,Sphingomyelin,Ceramide 2-aminoethylphosphonate,GM3,Digalactosylceramide,N-Acetyl-D-galactosaminyl-(N-acetylneuraminyl)-D-galactosyl-D-glucosylceramide,Dihydroceramide,3-Dehydrosphinganine,GM4,Galactosylceramide,Phytoceramide,Globoside,Digalactosylceramide sulfate,GA2,Glucosylceramide,Phytosphingosine,L-Serine,Ceramide 1-phosphate,N-Acylsphingosine,Sphingosine,D-Glucosylsphingosine >>>

The experiment identified the sphingolipid metabolism pathway as being significantly altered. This pathway was implicated due to the changes observed in multiple genes and compounds associated with sphingolipid synthesis and degradation. The genes ARSA, ACER1, GM2A, B4GALT5, SGPP2, CERS6, CERS1, CERS4, CERS3, B4GALNT1, SGMS1, HEXB, SMPD1, GBA1, ASAH2, and PLPP3 are all involved in sphingolipid metabolism. Similarly, the altered compounds such as Ceramide phosphoethanolamine, Gangliotriaosylceramide-II3 sulfate, Psychosine, and Glucosylceramide, among others, are intermediates or end products of this pathway. The findings suggest that disruptions in this pathway may contribute to the specific condition being studied.

List of genes : <<< HPD,MAOB,GOT1,TAT,DDC >>>
List of compounds : <<< trans-2-Hydroxycinnamate,2-Hydroxyphenylacetate,3-(2-Hydroxyphenyl)propanoate,D-Phenylalanine,L-Phenylalanine,Phenylethyl alcohol,L-Tyrosine,Phenylacetic acid >>>

In the experiment, the metabolic pathway identified to be significantly altered is the Phenylalanine metabolism. This is supported by the observation of altered genes and compounds associated with this pathway. The genes HPD, MAOB, GOT1, TAT, and DDC are all involved in Phenylalanine metabolism. HPD encodes the enzyme responsible for the first step in phenylalanine degradation, MAOB is involved in the breakdown of phenylalanine-derived compounds, GOT1 catalyzes the conversion of phenylalanine to tyrosine, TAT is a tyrosine aminotransferase, and DDC is involved in the conversion of DOPA to dopamine. The compounds trans-2-Hydroxycinnamate, 2-Hydroxyphenylacetate, 3-(2-Hydroxyphenyl)propanoate, D-Phenylalanine, L-Phenylalanine, Phenylethyl alcohol, L-Tyrosine, and Phenylacetic acid are all intermediates or products of the Phenylalanine metabolism pathway. Therefore, the alteration of these genes and compounds strongly suggests that the Phenylalanine metabolism pathway is involved in the condition being studied.

List of genes : <<< QPRT,NT5M,SIRT5,NMNAT1,SIRT7,NMNAT2,SIRT4,NUDT12,NMRK1,SIRT2,NADK2 >>>
List of compounds : <<< 1-Methylnicotinamide,Pseudooxynicotine,2,5-Dihydroxypyridine >>>

The metabolic pathway identified in the experiment is the Nicotinate and nicotinamide metabolism. This pathway was implicated due to the alterations in genes and compounds directly associated with it. The genes QPRT, NT5M, NUDT12, NMRK1, and NADK2 are all involved in the metabolism of nicotinate and nicotinamide. Additionally, the compounds 1-Methylnicotinamide, Pseudooxynicotine, and 2,5-Dihydroxypyridine are intermediates or products of this pathway. The SIRT family genes (SIRT5, SIRT7, SIRT4, SIRT2) and NMNAT genes (NMNAT1, NMNAT2) are also involved in NAD+ metabolism, which is closely linked to the Nicotinate and nicotinamide metabolism pathway. Therefore, the alterations in these genes and compounds suggest a significant role of the Nicotinate and nicotinamide metabolism pathway in the observed condition.

List of genes : <<< UGT1A8,UGT2B7,UGT2A2,UGT2B4,AKR1B15,RPEL1,DHDH,GUSB,UGT2B10,SORD,UGT1A3,FGGY,UGT1A9,AKR1B1,KL >>>
List of compounds : <<< L-Glyceraldehyde,2,5-Dioxopentanoate,2-Dehydro-3-deoxy-D-gluconate,Ribitol,D-Xylose,D-Ribulose >>>

In the experiment comparing two conditions, the metabolic pathway identified as significantly altered is the "Pentose and glucuronate interconversions" pathway. This conclusion is supported by the observed changes in several genes and compounds associated with this pathway. The genes UGT1A8, UGT2B7, UGT2A2, UGT2B4, UGT2B10, UGT1A3, and UGT1A9 are all UDP-glucuronosyltransferases, enzymes that play key roles in the glucuronidation process within this pathway. Moreover, the altered compounds such as L-Glyceraldehyde, 2,5-Dioxopentanoate, 2-Dehydro-3-deoxy-D-gluconate, Ribitol, D-Xylose, and D-Ribulose are intermediates or products of reactions within this pathway. The changes in these genes and compounds suggest perturbations in the Pentose and glucuronate interconversions pathway, which could contribute to the differences observed between the two conditions.

List of genes : <<< CERS2,NEU2,GLB1,GBA1,KDSR,SPTLC1,GALC,PSAP,SPTLC2,PLPP1 >>>
List of compounds : <<< Sphingosyl-phosphocholine,GA2,Sphinganine 1-phosphate,GA1,Digalactosylceramide sulfate,Sphingosine 1-phosphate,Dihydroceramide,Phytoceramide >>>

The experiment identified the Sphingolipid metabolism pathway as being involved in the specific condition. This is supported by the alterations observed in several genes and compounds associated with this pathway. The genes CERS2, NEU2, GLB1, GBA1, KDSR, SPTLC1, GALC, PSAP, SPTLC2, and PLPP1 are all involved in the synthesis, degradation, and regulation of sphingolipids. The altered compounds, including Sphingosyl-phosphocholine, Sphinganine 1-phosphate, Sphingosine 1-phosphate, Dihydroceramide, and Phytoceramide, are intermediates or end products of this pathway. Furthermore, the presence of Digalactosylceramide sulfate and GA1, which are complex sphingolipids, further supports the involvement of the Sphingolipid metabolism pathway. These findings suggest that dysregulation of this pathway may contribute to the specific condition.

List of genes : <<< PLA2G10,PLA2G2F,PLA2G6,CYP2J2,PLA2G5,CYP2C9,CYP3A4,PLA2G3,PLA2G2A,CYP1A2,PLAAT2,PLA2G4F,PLA2G4C >>>
List of compounds : <<< 9(S)-HODE,Arachidonate,9,10,13-TriHOME,(6Z,9Z,12Z)-Octadecatrienoic acid,9-OxoODE,Dihomo-gamma-linolenate,12(13)-EpOME,Phosphatidylcholine >>>

The experiment identified the Linoleic acid metabolism pathway as being significantly altered. This conclusion is supported by the changes observed in multiple genes and compounds directly involved in this pathway. The Phospholipase A2 (PLA2) family genes, including PLA2G10, PLA2G2F, PLA2G6, PLA2G5, PLA2G3, PLA2G2A, PLA2G4F, and PLA2G4C, are known to catalyze the release of linoleic acid from phospholipids. Additionally, the Cytochrome P450 (CYP) family genes, such as CYP2J2, CYP2C9, CYP3A4, and CYP1A2, are involved in the oxidation of linoleic acid and its derivatives. The observed changes in compounds such as 9(S)-HODE, Arachidonate, 9,10,13-TriHOME, (6Z,9Z,12Z)-Octadecatrienoic acid, 9-OxoODE, Dihomo-gamma-linolenate, and 12(13)-EpOME, which are intermediates and products of the Linoleic acid metabolism, further support this finding. Therefore, the alterations in these genes and compounds suggest a significant role of the Linoleic acid metabolism pathway in the condition under study.

List of genes : <<< PLA2G2A,PLA2G10,CYP2C19,JMJD7-PLA2G4B,PLB1,PLA2G4E,CYP2E1,PLA2G2D,PLA2G4C,PLA2G6,PLA2G4B,PLA2G2C,CYP2C8 >>>
List of compounds : <<< (9Z,12Z)-(11S)-11-Hydroperoxyoctadeca-9,12-dienoic acid,Dihomo-gamma-linolenate,(9Z,11E)-(13S)-13-Hydroperoxyoctadeca-9,11-dienoic acid,9,10,13-TriHOME,9(S)-HPODE,9,10-12,13-Diepoxyoctadecanoate,Arachidonate,Phosphatidylcholine,13(S)-HODE,12,13-Epoxy-9-hydroxy-10-octadecenoate >>>

The analysis of the provided data suggests that the Linoleic acid metabolism pathway is significantly altered in the given condition. This conclusion is based on the observation of multiple genes and compounds associated with this pathway. Several genes identified, such as PLA2G2A, PLA2G10, PLA2G4B, and PLA2G6, are phospholipases that play crucial roles in the release of linoleic acid from phospholipids. The presence of compounds like Arachidonate, which is a product of linoleic acid metabolism, and various hydroperoxy and epoxy derivatives of linoleic acid, further support this conclusion. The alterations in genes such as CYP2C19 and CYP2C8, which encode for cytochrome P450 enzymes involved in the metabolism of fatty acids, also fit with this pathway. Therefore, it is likely that the Linoleic acid metabolism pathway is significantly involved in the given condition.

List of genes : <<< DLD,DLST,AMT,BCKDHB,PDHA2,PDHB,LIAS,BCKDHA,DLAT,LIPT1,DBT,GCSH,ACSM1,GLDC,,DHTKD1,LIPT2 >>>
List of compounds : <<< (S)-3-Methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid,Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine,[Dihydrolipoyllysine-residue succinyltransferase] S-glutaryldihydrolipoyllysine,[Dihydrolipoyllysine-residue (2-methylpropanoyl)transferase] S-(2-methylbutanoyl)dihydrolipoyllysine,Octanoic acid,Lipoyl-AMP,Thiamin diphosphate,Dihydrolipoylprotein,Thiamin diphosphate,Thiamin diphosphate,(S)-2-Methylbutanoyl-CoA,(R)-Lipoate,4-Methyl-2-oxopentanoate,Glycine,Dihydrolipoate,Lipoylprotein,[Lipoyl-carrier protein E2]-N6-octanoyl-L-lysine,5,10-Methylenetetrahydrofolate,Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine,Enzyme N6-(lipoyl)lysine >>>

The metabolic pathway identified in this experiment is Lipoic Acid Metabolism. This conclusion is supported by the alterations in genes and compounds associated with this pathway. The genes DLD, DLST, DLAT, and DBT are all involved in lipoic acid metabolism, specifically in the citric acid cycle and the oxidative decarboxylation of pyruvate. The altered compounds, such as Dihydrolipoylprotein, Lipoyl-AMP, and Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine, are intermediates in this pathway. The presence of Thiamin diphosphate, a coenzyme required for the proper function of several enzymes in this pathway, further supports this conclusion. The alteration in these genes and compounds suggests a disruption in Lipoic Acid Metabolism, which could potentially impact energy production and oxidative stress response in the cell.

List of genes : <<< SQOR,PAPSS1,TST >>>
List of compounds : <<< L-Serine,Sulfur >>>

The experiment identified the Sulfur metabolism pathway as the primary metabolic pathway involved in the condition. This conclusion is supported by the alterations observed in the genes SQOR, PAPSS1, and TST, and the compounds L-Serine and Sulfur. SQOR encodes for sulfide:quinone oxidoreductase, an enzyme involved in sulfur metabolism. PAPSS1 is associated with the activation of sulfate in the body, while TST is involved in the conversion of homocysteine to cystathionine in the transsulfuration pathway, a subpathway of sulfur metabolism. The alteration in L-Serine, which is a precursor in the transsulfuration pathway, further supports this finding. Therefore, the changes in these genes and compounds suggest that disturbances in sulfur metabolism may be contributing to the condition.

List of genes : <<< NNT,SIRT3,NMRK2,NT5C1B,AOX1,NAPRT,NMNAT2,NT5E,NMRK1,NUDT12,SIRT4,NT5C,CD38,NMNAT1,ENPP1,PNP,NADK2 >>>
List of compounds : <<< 2,6-Dihydroxy-N-methylmyosmine,Nicotinate D-ribonucleoside,6-Hydroxypseudooxynicotine,Propanoate,1-Methylnicotinamide,Maleic acid,(R)-6-Hydroxynicotine,Nicotinamide >>>

The experiment suggests that the Nicotinate and Nicotinamide Metabolism pathway is involved in the condition of interest. This conclusion is supported by the alteration of multiple genes associated with this pathway, including NNT, SIRT3, NMRK2, NT5C1B, AOX1, NAPRT, NMNAT2, NT5E, NMRK1, NUDT12, SIRT4, NT5C, CD38, NMNAT1, ENPP1, and PNP. These genes play roles in nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD+) biosynthesis and degradation, which are central to this metabolic pathway. Furthermore, the altered compounds, such as Nicotinate D-ribonucleoside, 1-Methylnicotinamide, and Nicotinamide, are direct components or intermediates of this pathway. Therefore, it is likely that the observed condition is associated with disturbances in Nicotinate and Nicotinamide Metabolism.

List of genes : <<< PLPP2,PLA2G2F,PLD3,PLPP3 >>>
List of compounds : <<< 1-Alkyl-2-acylglycerophosphoethanolamine,1-Alkenyl-2-acylglycerol,O-1-Alk-1-enyl-2-acyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine,1-(1-Alkenyl)-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine,Seminolipid,2-Acyl-1-(1-alkenyl)-sn-glycero-3-phosphate,1-Alkyl-sn-glycerol,Acylglycerone phosphate >>>

The experiment identified the Ether lipid metabolism pathway as being significantly altered in the two conditions. This pathway was implicated due to the changes observed in several genes and compounds associated with it. The genes PLPP2, PLA2G2F, PLD3, and PLPP3, all of which are known to play key roles in the biosynthesis and metabolism of ether lipids, were found to be altered. Similarly, the compounds identified, including 1-Alkyl-2-acylglycerophosphoethanolamine, 1-Alkenyl-2-acylglycerol, and others, are intermediates and end products of the Ether lipid metabolism pathway. These findings suggest that the observed condition may be linked to disruptions in the synthesis, degradation, or regulation of ether lipids, underscoring the importance of this pathway in the biological processes under investigation.

List of compounds : <<< N-((R)-Pantothenoyl)-L-cysteine,2-Dehydropantoate,Pantothenate,beta-Alanine,3-Ureidopropionate,(S)-2-Acetolactate,(R)-4'-Phosphopantothenoyl-L-cysteine,Pantetheine 4'-phosphate,3-Aminopropanal,(R)-2,3-Dihydroxy-3-methylbutanoate,L-Cysteine,CoA,Pantothenol,Pantetheine,5,6-Dihydrouracil,L-Aspartate >>>

The metabolic pathway identified in this experiment is the Pantothenate and CoA biosynthesis pathway. This conclusion is supported by the alterations observed in multiple genes and compounds associated with this pathway. Several genes involved in this pathway, such as BCAT2, PANK1, PANK2, PANK3, COASY, and ALDH2, were altered, indicating potential disruptions in the synthesis of pantothenate and CoA. Additionally, the levels of several key compounds in this pathway, including N-((R)-Pantothenoyl)-L-cysteine, 2-Dehydropantoate, Pantothenate, Pantetheine 4'-phosphate, CoA, Pantothenol, and Pantetheine, were also altered, further supporting the involvement of this pathway. The alterations in these genes and compounds suggest that the Pantothenate and CoA biosynthesis pathway may be dysregulated in the condition being studied.

List of genes : <<< ACSL5,CPT1B,ACOX1,ACOX3 >>>
List of compounds : <<< trans-Hexadec-2-enoyl-[acp],Acetyl-CoA,(8Z,11Z,14Z,17Z,20Z)-Hexacosapentaenoyl-CoA,3-Oxodecanoyl-CoA,Acetyl-CoA,Acetyl-CoA,Stearoyl-CoA,(7Z,10Z,13Z)-Docosatrienoyl-CoA,3-Oxotetradecanoyl-[acp],Arachidonyl-CoA,(6Z,9Z,12Z,15Z,18Z)-Tetracosapentaenoyl-CoA >>>

The experiment identified the fatty acid metabolism pathway as being significantly altered. This is supported by the changes observed in the genes and compounds associated with this pathway. The genes ACSL5, CPT1B, ACOX1, and ACOX3 are all involved in fatty acid metabolism. ACSL5 activates long-chain fatty acids for Î²-oxidation, CPT1B transports fatty acids into the mitochondria for Î²-oxidation, and ACOX1 and ACOX3 are involved in peroxisomal Î²-oxidation. The altered compounds, such as trans-Hexadec-2-enoyl-[acp], Acetyl-CoA, and various acyl-CoA esters, are intermediates in fatty acid synthesis and degradation. The presence of these compounds, along with the changes in gene expression, suggests that the fatty acid metabolism pathway is indeed affected in this condition.

List of genes : <<< PDHA2,ACSM1 >>>
List of compounds : <<< (R)-Lipoate,Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine,4-Carboxy-1-hydroxybutyryl-ThPP,[Dihydrolipoyllysine-residue (2-methylpropanoyl)transferase] S-(2-methylpropanoyl)dihydrolipoyllysine,Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine,(S)-3-Methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid,Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine,Dihydrolipoylprotein,Succinyl-CoA,Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine,Dihydrolipoate,Glycine >>>

The metabolic pathway identified from the experiment is Lipoic Acid Metabolism. This conclusion is supported by the alterations in the genes PDHA2 and ACSM1, and the presence of various compounds such as (R)-Lipoate, Enzyme N6-(dihydrolipoyl)lysine, and Dihydrolipoylprotein. The gene PDHA2 encodes the E1 alpha subunit of pyruvate dehydrogenase, an enzyme complex that requires lipoic acid for its function in the conversion of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA. ACSM1, on the other hand, is involved in fatty acid metabolism, another process that requires lipoic acid. The altered compounds are intermediates and cofactors in the Lipoic Acid Metabolism pathway, further supporting the identification of this pathway.

List of genes : <<< MVD,PMVK,HMGCR,DHDDS,ICMT,FNTB,NUS1,PDSS1,CHURC1-FNTB,GGPS1,IDI2 >>>
List of compounds : <<< all-trans-Decaprenyl diphosphate,trans-Anhydromevalonate phosphate,Protein C-terminal S-farnesyl-L-cysteine methyl ester,(R)-Mevalonate 3,5-bisphosphate,2-Phospho-4-(cytidine 5'-diphospho)-2-C-methyl-D-erythritol >>>

The metabolic pathway identified in the experiment is the Terpenoid backbone biosynthesis. This pathway was implicated due to the alterations in genes such as MVD, PMVK, HMGCR, DHDDS, GGPS1, and IDI2, which are all known to be involved in this pathway. The MVD and PMVK genes are involved in the mevalonate pathway, a subpathway of terpenoid backbone biosynthesis. HMGCR, a rate-limiting enzyme in this pathway, was also altered. The alteration in DHDDS suggests changes in the synthesis of isopentenyl diphosphate and dimethylallyl diphosphate, which are key intermediates in terpenoid backbone biosynthesis. Furthermore, the alteration in GGPS1 and IDI2, which are involved in geranylgeranyl diphosphate and isopentenyl diphosphate synthesis respectively, further supports this conclusion. The altered compounds, including all-trans-Decaprenyl diphosphate, trans-Anhydromevalonate phosphate, and (R)-Mevalonate 3,5-bisphosphate, are also intermediates in this pathway, providing additional evidence.

The metabolic pathway identified in this experiment is Steroid Biosynthesis. This pathway was implicated due to the alterations observed in genes and compounds directly involved in steroid synthesis. Genes such as LBR, CYP24A1, DHCR24, CYP2R1, HSD17B7, NSDHL, LSS, CYP51A1, CYP27B1, and SC5D are known to participate in this pathway. Similarly, the altered compounds, including 24-epi-Campesterol, Zymosterone, Lathosterol, (S)-2,3-Epoxysqualene, 5-Dehydroepisterol, Cycloartenol, and others, are intermediates in the Steroid Biosynthesis pathway. Therefore, the changes in these genes and compounds suggest that the Steroid Biosynthesis pathway is significantly involved in the condition under study.

List of genes : <<< EHHADH,ELOVL5,CPT1A >>>
List of compounds : <<< Hexadecanoyl-[acp],(S)-3-Hydroxyhexadecanoyl-CoA,(5Z,8Z,11Z)-Icosatrienoyl-CoA,Butyryl-[acp],(8Z,11Z)-Icosadienoyl-CoA >>>

The metabolic pathway identified from the experiment is Fatty Acid Metabolism. This conclusion is supported by the alterations in genes and compounds associated with this pathway. The genes EHHADH, ELOVL5, and CPT1A are key players in fatty acid metabolism. EHHADH encodes an enzyme involved in the last step of peroxisomal beta-oxidation of fatty acids, while ELOVL5 is responsible for elongating very long-chain fatty acids. CPT1A encodes the rate-limiting enzyme for fatty acid oxidation in the mitochondria. The altered compounds, such as Hexadecanoyl-[acp], (S)-3-Hydroxyhexadecanoyl-CoA, (5Z,8Z,11Z)-Icosatrienoyl-CoA, Butyryl-[acp], and (8Z,11Z)-Icosadienoyl-CoA, are intermediates in fatty acid synthesis and degradation, further supporting the involvement of the fatty acid metabolism pathway in the observed condition.

The metabolic pathway identified in this experiment is the Fatty Acid Elongation pathway. This conclusion is supported by the alterations observed in the genes and compounds involved in this pathway. The genes ACAA2, ELOVL6, HACD3, and HADHB are all known to play crucial roles in fatty acid elongation. ACAA2 encodes an enzyme involved in the final step of fatty acid beta-oxidation, which is closely linked to fatty acid elongation. ELOVL6 is a key enzyme in elongating very long chain fatty acids. HACD3 is involved in the elongation of very long chain fatty acids and the synthesis of sphingolipids, while HADHB encodes a subunit of the mitochondrial trifunctional protein, which is involved in both beta-oxidation and the elongation of odd-chain fatty acids. The altered compounds, including various acyl-CoAs and long-chain fatty acids, are direct intermediates or products of the fatty acid elongation process, further supporting this conclusion.
